column12: Definitions
column13: Remarks

Sequencing is based on sequence groups where each group runs independent sequences. Sequence groups are a unique combination of the following fields:
- srcApplication
- msgID
- msgSequenceID
- msgDateTime

column12: The healthcare institution where this message is sent from. This is usually the abbreviated name of the healthcare institution.
column13:
Content Population: This field should be populated based on the following priority and its availability:
1. HCI code of the institution
2. Abbreviated name of the institution

Sample Value: "1600000" for HCI code and "CGH" for abbreviated name

column12: The source system application name from where this message is sent from.
column13: Sample Value: "JHS-EPIC"

column12: The message id uniquely identifies this message by the source system.
column13: Sample Value: "00033065"

column12:
This field identifies the sequence of messages. The msgSequenceID forms part of the unique sequence group which also consists of:
-  Data type (Web Service Interface name)
- srcApplication (provided in controlHeader)
- srcInstitution (provided in controlHeader)
column13:
Content Population: Numbering of msgSequenceID for each message sent by the respective sequence group must be incremental.

Sample Value: "1"

column12: The timestamp is the date and time when this clinical message is being generated by the source system application.
column13:
Validation: The expected format is "[-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ|+08:00".

Sample Value: "2010-07-11T14:19:20+8:00"

column12: This field indicates the type of request that this event message represents.
column13:
Content Population:
There are 4 values which can be used:
1. "Clinical": This value is used when source system wants to create/update both demographics and clinical segment of the XML (i.e. "<patient>" and "<event>" elements).

2. "Administrative": This value is used when source system wants to create/update only demographics segment of the XML (i.e. "<patient>" element only).

3. "Merge": This value is used when source system wants to merge 2 different patient identification as 1 common patient instance. There should be 2 "<identification>" sections in the message payload; one section with "Obsolete" and one section with "Survivor" for the "<patientMergeType>" element.

4. "Cancel": This value is used when source system wants to perform a patient master cancel without any event data segment.

column18: Refer to PutPatientMedicationList for Patient mapping

column12: The patient's id which is used to uniquely identify this patient outside an healthcare institution. This identifier can be the UIN, FIN or NRIC number.
column13:
Content Population: If this information is not available at source, source is to populate this field with MRN Number.

Sample Value: "S9437127I"

column12: The MRN number stands for the Patient Medical Record Number. It is an unique non-editable identifier for the patient and his/her medical record/information within the source system.
column13: Sample Value: "S9437127I"

column12: This field indicates the type of document that is used to provide the value in the "id" field.
column13:
Content Population: This field should be populated based on the following priority and its availability:
1. NHDD code that is equivalent to the original source code that is input/selected by the user.
2. Description entered/selected by the user at source UI
3. Description stored at source database

Sample Value: "SP" for Singapore Pink Identification Card

column12:
This field is used only when a patient merge is populated. 

The value of this field will indicate if the patient information is an "Obsolete" or a "Survivor".
column13:
Validation: 
- This field should be populated if "controlHeader > msgType" is populated as "Merge".
- The only values allowed for this field is "Obsolete" or "Survivor".

Sample Value: "Survivor"

column12: The patient name commonly and currently used by the patient in official communication or entered in legal documents.
Name of the patient.
column13:
Content Population: If source system captures this patient's name using multiple fields, this field should be populated with the concatenated value of the "First Name (or Given Name)" and the "Last Name".

Sample Value: "John Doe"

column12: Title/Salutation of the patient.
column13:
Content Population: This field should be populated based on the following priority and its availability:
1. NHDD code that is equivalent to the original source code that is input/selected by the user.
2. Description entered/selected by the user at source UI
3. Description stored at source database

Sample Value:   "Mr"

column12: An alternate name, if this patient is known by a name other than the one specified in the "name" field.
column13: Content Population: This could be this patient's name before marriage or change of religion.

column12: Information of this patient's contact address.
This field describes whether the given address is the main address.
column13:
Validation:
- The only values allowed for this field are  "MAIN" and "OTHER".
- There should not be more than one address of the same type.
- This field should be populated if any of the following fields are populated.
1. streetLine1
2. streetLine2
3. streetLine3
4. streetLine4
5. city
6. country
7. postalCode

column12: The street name of this contact address.
column13: Sample Value: "AMK Rd"

column12: The block or house number of this contact address.
column13: Sample Value: "Block 123"

column12: The floor number of this contact address.
column13: Sample Value: Assuming floor and unit number is "#12-34", then sample value will be "12"

column12: The unit number of this contact address.
column13: Sample Value: Assuming floor and unit number is "#12-34", then sample value will be "34"

column12: The city of where this patient's contact address is located.
column13: Sample Value: "Singapore"

column12: The country of where this patient's contact address is located.
column13:
Content Population: This field should be populated based on the following priority and its availability:

column13: Sample Value: "123456"

column12: Information of this patient's phone contacts.
This field describes whether the phone number is a Home, Mobile, or Work number.
column13:
Validation: 
- The only values allowed for this field are "HOME","MOBILE" and "WORK"
- There should not be more than one phone of the same type.
- This field should be populated if any of the following fields are populated.
1. countryCode
2. areaCode
3. phoneNumber
4. extensionNumber

column12: The phone number of this patient

Content Population: The value populated in this field should exclude <countryCode>, <areaCode> and <extensionNumber> if they are populated in their individual fields.

Validation: If this field is populated, the "type" field within this segment must also be populated.

Sample Value: "9123 4566"

column12: The extension number of this patient which one should dial when the phone number provided is generic.
column13: Content Population: This applies to large organisation or entity where there is a common phone number and each individual are provided with an extension.

column12:
A patient episode/case can have multiple encounters. A putEvent message will be sent for each encounter and the value populated in the "id" field will be used to identify the episode/case that this encounter belongs to. Example of an encounter includes:
1. an outpatient visit
2. an ED visit
3. patient admissions
4. patient discharge

Ward transfer does not require the trigger of a putEvent message.
column13: Validation: This segment should be populated if the "controlHeader > msgType" is populated with "Clinical".

column12: A unique identifier for this encounter record within the source system.
column13:
Content Population: 
- If multiple source fields are required to form the unique identifier, these fields should be concatenated and mapped to this field.
- The value populated in this field should remain the same for any subsequent amendments or cancellation. 

Sample Value: "SGH^10^1151874"

column12: An identifier of the episode/case within the source system.
column13:
Content Population: The value populated in this field should remain the same for any subsequent amendments or cancellation.

Sample Value: "6910032858D"
column16:
String (2000)
For existing source systems - the combined length of the following fields should not exceed 1997:
1. id
2. movementSequenceNo

column12: This field identifies the sequence of this encounter record within the episode/case specified in the "id" field.
column13:
Content Population: To increase the movement sequence number for subsequent encounters in a patient visit.

Sample Value: "00001"
column16:
String (2000)
For existing source systems - the combined length of the following fields should not exceed 1997:
1. id
2. movementSequenceNo

column12: The date and time when this encounter starts for the patient.
column13:
Content Population:
- Based on the value populated in the "eventType" field, this field should be populated with the following information.
1. Admission encounter - Date of admission
2. Outpatient encounter - Date of visit
3. Discharge encounter - Date of discharge
- If source system is only able to send the date (without time), to populate the time with "00:00:00"

Validation: The expected format is "[-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss".

Sample Value: "2010-07-11T14:19:20"

column12: The date and time when this patient is discharged for this encounter.
column13:
Content Population: This field is applicable only for patient discharge encounter. If source system is only able to send the date (without time), to populate the time with "00:00:00"

Validation: The expected format is "[-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss".

Sample Value: "2010-07-13T14:19:20"

column12: Indicates whether this encounter is cancelled.
column13:
Validation: The only values allowed for this field are:
- "true" indicates that this encounter is cancelled.
- "false" indicates that this encounter is not cancelled.

column12: The identifier of the healthcare institution (i.e. HCI code) where the care is provided for this patient during this encounter.
column13:
Validation: This field should be populated with a valid HCI code.

Sample Value:  "1600000"

column12: The type of clinical unit or specialty responsible for the patient's care during this encounter.
The coded value that is input/selected by the user.
column13:
Content Population: This field is to be populated based on the following priority:
1. Original source coded value that is input/selected by the user
2. NEHR code if source does not have any corresponding code-set

Validation: This field should only be populated if coded value is used.

Sample Value:  "NEHR_SVC_0040"

column12: The name of the code-set that the coded value belongs to.
column13:
Content Population: If source uses original source-defined code-set, MOHH will provide the codingSchemeName to be used

NEHR Code-set: If source does not have any corresponding code-set, this field should be populated using "Service_Specialty_(NEHR)"

Validation: This field should only be populated if "code" is populated.

column12: The version of the code-set that is used when the code is selected.
column13: Validation: This field should be populated if versioned code-set is used.

column12: The description that is entered/selected by the user for this field.
column13:

1. Description entered/selected by the user at source UI
2. Description stored at source database
3. Description of the value populated in "code"

Sample Value: "Physiotherapy"

column12: This field represents the nature of this encounter to determine if it is an inpatient stay or an outpatient visit.
The coded value that is input/selected by the user.
column13:
Content Population: This field is to be populated with the NEHR code that is equivalent to the original source code that is input/selected by the user. The following values should be used:
1. "I" - Inpatient stay
2. "O" - Outpatient visit

Validation: This field should only be populated if coded value is used.

column12: This field describes the movement categories for an Admission or Outpatient encounter.
column13:
Content Population:
- If the eventType is "1" (Admission encounter), this field should be populated with the Admission Type information.
- If the  eventType is "4" (Outpatient encounter), this field should be populated with the Visit Type information.
- If the eventType is "2" (Discharge encounter), refer to "dischargeDisposition" field for movement categories for a discharge encounter.

column12: The coded value that is input/selected by the user.
column13:
Content Population: This field is to be populated based on the following priority:
1. Original source coded value that is input/selected by the user
2. NEHR code if source does not have any corresponding code-set

Validation: This field should only be populated if coded value is used.

Sample Value:  "DS"

column12: The name of the code-set that the coded value belongs to.
column13:
Content Population: If source does not have any corresponding code-set, MOHH will provide the codingSchemeName to be used

NEHR Code-set:
- If source does not have any corresponding code-set and "eventType > code" field is populated with "1" (Admission encounter), this field should be populated using "Admission_Type_(NEHR)".
- If source does not have any corresponding code-set and "eventType > code" field is populated with "4" (Outpatient encounter), this field should be populated using "Visit_Type_(NEHR)".

Validation: This field should only be populated if "code" is populated.

column12: The version of the code-set that is used when the code is selected.
column13: Validation: This field should be populated if versioned code-set is used.
